attributes.action: Give businesses forced to remain closed past 4th July 2020 a 2nd business grant
attributes.additional_details:
Businesses made to close 23/03/20 by the government. The government gave grants based on business rates for non essential businesses with premises.
Non essential retail were reopened 5/6/20 followed by all other businesses 4/7/20 except
Nightclubs 
Bowling 
Indoor skating rinks
Indoor play areas
Beauty, Tattoo, piercing studios
Indoor gyms, sports venues
Swimming pools
Exhibition centres 
These businesses are expected to survive on the same grant given to all.
This is economically unjust.
attributes.background: We request that the government give all businesses that are forced to remain closed after the 4th July 2020 a second business grant of the same value as the first grant given as we have had to stay closed for twice as long as most.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/329210

Since you started your petition the Government has announced that additional businesses are able to open. You can find additional information about which businesses are allowed to open, and which are still required to remain closed, here: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/further-businesses-and-premises-to-close/further-businesses-and-premises-to-close-guidance
